headline: How major US stock indexes fared Thursday, 7/24/2025

headline: Dow Inc. Cuts Dividend by 50% and the Stock Sinks
summary: The operating environment just didn’t improve fast enough for  Dow Inc.  The commodity chemicals producer slashed its dividend on Thursday to preserve cash in tough times.  The new quarterly payout is 35 cents, down from 70 cents.  “Today’s announcement aims to ensure we maximize long-term shareholder value as we navigate a prolonged industry downturn and the resulting lower-for-longer earnings environment,” said CEO Jim Fitterling in a news release.

headline: Stocks to Watch Thursday: Tesla, T-Mobile, American Airlines, Broadcom
summary: ↘️ Tesla (TSLA): The EV maker reported a 16% drop in quarterly net income and said car sales continued to fall. Shares fell 9% in Thursday morning trading. ↗️ Alphabet (GOOGL): The Google and YouTube parent reported a jump in revenue driven by cloud growth and hiked its annual capital-expenditure forecast.

headline: Dow Cuts Dividend In Half As Losses Mount And Tariffs Amplify Industry Pain
summary: Dow Inc. (NYSE:DOW) shares plummeted Thursday after the chemical manufacturer posted a larger-than-expected loss in the second quarter and cut its dividend in half. The company cited persistent macroeconomic pressure, margin compression, and global trade disruptions as reasons for the cutback. The company reported an adjusted loss of 42 cents per share, wider than Wall Street’s projected 12-cent loss, according to consensus estimates. Revenue fell 7% year over year to $10.104 billion, missing th

headline: Dow declares quarterly dividend of 35 cents per share
summary: Dow (NYSE: DOW) today announced that its Board of Directors has declared a dividend of 35 cents per share. The adjustment in payout size reflects Dow's balanced capital allocation approach and enhances financial flexibility amidst a persistently challenging macroeconomic environment.
